thread.title: Molly-Mae Hague addresses Tommy Fury breakup after cheating rumors
thread.title_full: Molly-Mae Hague addresses Tommy Fury breakup after cheating rumors

author: Jenna Lemoncelli
title: Molly-Mae Hague addresses Tommy Fury breakup after cheating rumors
text:
Molly-Mae Hague revealed how she’s been coping following her breakup with Tommy Fury in a candid YouTube video posted Thursday.
The British fashion entrepreneur and the pro boxer — who met during the fifth season of “Love Island U.K.” in 2019 and got engaged last summer — announced their split earlier this month after five years together, with Fury becoming the subject of cheating rumors in the aftermath.
“The last two weeks have been very, very real and it’s real life — and it’s something that we’ve been going through as privately as we can,” Hague said in the video. “But obviously, not privately whatsoever because I haven’t really been able to get away from it for the past couple of weeks. And the last thing that I want to do is come on here and fuel that more and just talk about it really, because it’s just not my coping mechanism.
4 Molly-Mae Hague addresses her breakup with Tommy Fury in video on YouTube on August 29, 2024. YouTube/MollyMae “My coping mechanism for the last couple of weeks has been talking to the people that I love and are so close to me and have been so incredible through this time — and then going on here and sort of just pushing forward.”
Hague emphasized that she won’t “spill the tea” and reveal what happened.
Explore More NHL star, brother struck and killed by car in NJ while riding bikes a day before sister's wedding Yankees stars, wives take in US Open action on night off Rutgers coach gets shade for running up score in blowout win “I don’t really ever plan on talking about the last couple of weeks,” she said. “It’s just not something I feel comfortable with … It is not drama, it is not tea, it is not a publicity stunt. This is real life and it’s very sad and it’s very deep.”
Hague went on to explain that “it doesn’t feel right” to discuss the situation publicly out of respect for Fury, with whom she shares a 1-year-old daughter, Bambi.
4 Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury. Instagram/Molly-Mae Hague 4 Jake Paul punches Tommy Fury during the Cruiserweight Title fight between Jake Paul and Tommy Fury at the Diriyah Arena on February 26, 2023 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Getty Images “Also out of respect to Tommy as well because it’s just not nice and I feel like everything over the last couple of weeks has really been a lot and been blown way out of proportion and it’s all gotten a little bit carried away with itself. And the last thing I want to be doing is fueling that fire anymore and stirring the pot when it just doesn’t need to be stirred.
“I just feel like for me, the best way to just deal with this is to just move forward and keep it moving. Just look to the future.”
4 Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury with their daughter at Disney. mollymae/Instagram She went on to thank her online community for their support and messages.
Hague and Fury, both 25, confirmed their breakup in separate social media statements this month.
The Sun previously reported that Hague kicked the boxer out of the $5 million mansion they shared in Cheshire, England, after she confronted him about cheating on her with multiple women.
Fury has yet to publicly address the report.
